translated: The Elder Padumacchadani’s Birth Story
“When the Lord of the World had passed away,
the foremost of the Vipassī’s disciples,
taking a lotus in full bloom,
I made a memorial mound.🔽When the memorial mound was made,
I rose up into the sky,
and having made a canopy in the sky,
I held it over the memorial mound.
For ninety-one eons
the flower I placed there,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
For seventy-three eons
the one named Padumissara,
conquering the four directions,
was a powerful Wheel-turning Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Padumacchadani recited these verses.
